messages.msgSnippet: -=- The mystery is finally solved. How does the small arrow on your computer monitor work when you move the mouse? -=- LOL! That s great. The kids got a big
messages.messageBody:
-=- The mystery is finally solved. How does the small arrow on your
computer monitor work when you move the mouse? -=-

LOL! That's great. The kids got a big kick out of it. :)

-=- A similarly wonderful thing is the DVD menu of An Evening with
Kevin Smith. -=-

One of my favorite Kevin Smith stories is about how he suckered Ben
Affleck into doing a movie for scale.

-=- There's a second Kevin Smith thing Marty got for Christmas and I
still haven't watched it all. It's called something like "A second
evening with Kevin Smith, Evening Harder" (a Die-Hard joke). -=-

I didn't know there was a second one. I'm going to get my Kevin Smith
Fan Points taken away...

-- Susan

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Cursor Secret
messages.msgSnippet: Linnaea thought it was brilliant! Schuyler www.waynforth.blogspot.com ... From:  To: ;
messages.messageBody:
Linnaea thought it was brilliant!

Schuyler
www.waynforth.blogspot.com
----- Original Message -----
From: <kbcdlovejo@...>
To: <unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com>; <AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 19, 2007 2:33 PM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Cursor Secret




The mystery is finally solved. How does the small arrow on your
computer monitor work when you move the mouse?

Click on the link below to find out. The image may take a moment or
two to download; when it appears, slowly move your mouse over the light
gray circle and you will see how the magic works.

http://www.1-click.jp/



This just cracked me up---and I thought some of you might get a chuckle
too!

Be sure to stop and click as well as move your cursor!

~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Cursor Secret
messages.msgSnippet: -=- http://www.1-click.jp/ This just cracked me up---and I thought some of you might get a chuckle too! -=- OH MY GOSH! That s wonderful, wonderful. My husband
messages.messageBody:
-=-
http://www.1-click.jp/

This just cracked me up---and I thought some of you might get a chuckle
too!
-=-

OH MY GOSH!

That's wonderful, wonderful.

My husband is a graphics engineer, and I called him and he's not at
his desk. OH NO!!!

So I called my next most engineering friend who's on a conference
call. I'm bursting to share that.

A similarly wonderful thing is the DVD menu of An Evening with Kevin
Smith. He does a long, long mime to live music while he's waiting
for you to click something, so don't click anything so you can see
the whole show. And if you're not all that interested in Kevin
Smith movies, go to the story of when he met Prince, which is one of
the best story-telling moments of the past decade. (Warning: He
does use "the f-word" a lot.)

That story is worth the price of the rental.

There's a second Kevin Smith thing Marty got for Christmas and I
still haven't watched it all. It's called something like "A second
evening with Kevin Smith, Evening Harder" (a Die-Hard joke).

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
